subject: Career
title: The Pomodoro Technique at Home
description: Learn The Pomodoro Technique at Home in one minute.

hook.text: 25 minutes of focused work. 5-minute break. Repeat. Francesco Cirillo's tomato timer changed productivity.

buildup.text: The Pomodoro Technique works because it creates urgency (limited time) and recovery (built-in breaks).

discovery.text: Research shows attention naturally wanes after 20-25 minutes. Pomodoros align with your brain's rhythm.

twist.text: For creative or deep work, standard Pomodoros may be too short. Extend to 50/10 for complex tasks.

climax.text: Track your Pomodoros. Knowing you complete 8-10 per day gives you a realistic capacity measure.

punchline.text: Short bursts with breaks beat marathon sessions without them.

quiz.question: Why does the Pomodoro Technique work?
options: It creates urgency and aligns with natural attention cycles
It forces you to work nonstop
